treatment.description: Plants 3–14 cm. Stems diffusely branched. Leaf blades linear to filiform, 15–35 × 0.5–1 mm. Invo-lucres narrowly obconic. Phyl-laries in 2 series, elliptic, glabrous or sparsely hirsuto-pilose. Ray (or pistillate) florets (4–)5(–6); corollas yellow to red-tipped, laminae 0–1 mm. Disc florets (3–)4(–5); corollas yellow, often reddish-tipped, linear-tubular, not contracted at lobes, lobes 3. Pappi of 3(–4) bristles, weakly dilated at bases. 2n = 18.
treatment.discussion: Pentachaeta alsinoides is easily recognized by its relatively small (2.6–3 mm), disciform heads and reddish, linear-tubular, 3-lobed disc corollas. The anthers of the disc florets often are sterile.
